critique: This executive order establishes a committee to coordinate federal planning activities related to the Appalachian Regional Development Act of 1965. It aims to address economic disparities in the Appalachian region by fostering collaboration among federal agencies. The order itself doesn't directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It leans towards federal involvement in regional economic development, but it also emphasizes cooperation and doesn't explicitly expand executive power beyond coordinating existing efforts. It does not seem to have a strong ideological leaning.
